Import Search Engine Results Pages (SERPs) for Google and YouTubeÂ¶

serp_goog(q, cx, key, c2coff=None, cr=None, dateRestrict=None, exactTerms=None, excludeTerms=None, fileType=None, filter=None, gl=None, highRange=None, hl=None, hq=None, imgColorType=None, imgDominantColor=None, imgSize=None, imgType=None, linkSite=None, lowRange=None, lr=None, num=None, orTerms=None, relatedSite=None, rights=None, safe=None, searchType=None, siteSearch=None, siteSearchFilter=None, sort=None, start=None)[source]Â¶

Query Google and get search results in a DataFrame.

For each parameter, you can supply single or multiple values / arguments.

If you pass multiple arguments, all the possible combinations of arguments (the product) will be requested, and you will get one DataFrame combining all queries. See examples below.

Parameters

  • q â€“ The search expression.

  • cx â€“ The custom search engine ID to use for this request.

  • key â€“ The API key of your custom search engine.

  • c2coff â€“ Enables or disablesÂ Simplified and Traditional Chinese Search.Â The default value for this parameter isÂ 0Â (zero), meaning that the feature is enabled. Supported values are:1: Disabled0: Enabled (default)

  • cr â€“ Restricts search results to documents originating in a particular country. You may useÂ Boolean operatorsÂ in theÂ crÂ parameterâ€™s value.Google Search determines the country of a document by analyzing:the top- level domain (TLD) of the documentâ€™s URLthe geographic location of the Web serverâ€™s IP addressSee theÂ Country Parameter ValuesÂ page for a list of valid values for this parameter.

  • dateRestrict â€“ Restricts results to URLs based on date. Supported values include:d[number]: requests results from the specified number of past days. - d[number]: requests results from the specified number of past days. - w[number]: requests results from the specified number of past weeks. - m[number]: requests results from the specified number of past months. - y[number]: requests results from the specified number of past years.

  • exactTerms â€“ Identifies a phrase that all documents in the search results must contain.

  • excludeTerms â€“ Identifies a word or phrase that should not appear in any documents in the search results.

  • fileType â€“ Restricts results to files of a specified extension. A list of file types indexable by GoogleÂ can be found in Search Console Help Center.

  • filter â€“ Controls turning on or off the duplicate content filter.SeeÂ Automatic FilteringÂ for more information about Googleâ€™s search results filters. Note that host crowding filtering applies only to multi-site searches.By default, Google applies filtering to all search results to improve the quality of those results. Acceptable values are: â€œ0â€: Turns off duplicate content filter. â€œ1â€: Turns on duplicate content filter.

  • gl â€“ Geolocation of end user.Â TheÂ glÂ parameter value is a two-letter country code. TheÂ glÂ parameter boosts search results whose country of origin matches the parameter value. See theÂ Country CodesÂ page for a list of valid values.Specifying aÂ glÂ parameter value should lead to more relevant results. This is particularly true for international customers and, even more specifically, for customers in English- speaking countries other than the United States.

  • highRange â€“ Specifies the ending value for a search range.UseÂ lowRangeÂ andÂ highRangeÂ to append an inclusive search range ofÂ lowRangeâ€¦highRange to the query.

  • hl â€“ Sets the user interface language.Â Explicitly setting this parameter improves the performance and the quality of your search results.See theÂ Interface LanguagesÂ section ofÂ Internationalizing Queries and Results PresentationÂ for more information, andÂ Supported Interface LanguagesÂ for a list of supported languages.

  • hq â€“ Appends the specified query terms to the query, as if they were combined with a logicalÂ ANDÂ operator.

  • imgColorType â€“ Returns black and white, grayscale, or color images: mono, gray, and color. Acceptable values are: â€œcolorâ€: color â€œgrayâ€: gray â€œmonoâ€: mono

  • imgDominantColor â€“ Returns images of a specific dominant color. Acceptable values are: â€œblackâ€: black â€œblueâ€: blue â€œbrownâ€: brown â€œgrayâ€: gray â€œgreenâ€: green â€œorangeâ€: orange â€œpinkâ€: pink â€œpurpleâ€: purple â€œredâ€: red â€œtealâ€: teal â€œwhiteâ€: white â€œyellowâ€: yellow

  • imgSize â€“ Returns images of a specified size. Acceptable values are: â€œhugeâ€: huge â€œiconâ€: icon â€œlargeâ€: large â€œmediumâ€: medium â€œsmallâ€: small â€œxlargeâ€: xlarge â€œxxlargeâ€: xxlarge

  • imgType â€“ Returns images of a type. Acceptable values are: â€œclipartâ€: clipart â€œfaceâ€: face â€œlineartâ€: lineart â€œnewsâ€: news â€œphotoâ€: photo

  • linkSite â€“ Specifies that all search results should contain a link to a particular URL

  • lowRange â€“ Specifies the starting value for a search range. UseÂ lowRangeÂ andÂ highRangeÂ to append an inclusive search range ofÂ lowRangeâ€¦highRangeÂ to the query.

  • lr â€“ Restricts the search to documents written in a particular language (e.g.,Â lr=lang_ja). Acceptable values are: â€œlang_arâ€: Arabic â€œlang_bgâ€: Bulgarian â€œlang_caâ€: Catalan â€œlang_csâ€: Czech â€œlang_daâ€: Danish â€œlang_deâ€: German â€œlang_elâ€: Greek â€œlang_enâ€: English â€œlang_esâ€: Spanish â€œlang_etâ€: Estonian â€œlang_fiâ€: Finnish â€œlang_frâ€: French â€œlang_hrâ€: Croatian â€œlang_huâ€: Hungarian â€œlang_idâ€: Indonesian â€œlang_isâ€: Icelandic â€œlang_itâ€: Italian â€œlang_iwâ€: Hebrew â€œlang_jaâ€: Japanese â€œlang_koâ€: Korean â€œlang_ltâ€: Lithuanian â€œlang_lvâ€: Latvian â€œlang_nlâ€: Dutch â€œlang_noâ€: Norwegian â€œlang_plâ€: Polish â€œlang_ptâ€: Portuguese â€œlang_roâ€: Romanian â€œlang_ruâ€: Russian â€œlang_skâ€: Slovak â€œlang_slâ€: Slovenian â€œlang_srâ€: Serbian â€œlang_svâ€: Swedish â€œlang_trâ€: Turkish â€œlang_zh- CNâ€: Chinese (Simplified) â€œlang_zh-TWâ€: Chinese (Traditional)

  • num â€“ Number of search results to return.Valid values are integers between 1 and 10, inclusive.

  • orTerms â€“ Provides additional search terms to check for in a document, where each document in the search results must contain at least one of the additional search terms.

  • relatedSite â€“ Specifies that all search results should be pages that are related to the specified URL.

  • rights â€“ Filters based on licensing. Supported values include: cc_publicdomain, cc_attribute, cc_sharealike, cc_noncommercial, cc_nonderived, and combinations of these.

  • safe â€“ Search safety level. Acceptable values are: â€œactiveâ€: Enables SafeSearch filtering. â€œoffâ€: Disables SafeSearch filtering. (default)

  • searchType â€“ Specifies the search type: image. If unspecified, results are limited to webpages. Acceptable values are: â€œimageâ€: custom image search.

  • siteSearch â€“ Specifies all search results should be pages from a given site.

  • siteSearchFilter â€“ Controls whether to include or exclude results from the site named in the siteSearch parameter. Acceptable values are: â€œeâ€: exclude â€œiâ€: include

  • sort â€“ The sort expression to apply to the results.

  • start â€“ The index of the first result to return.Valid value are integers starting 1 (default) and the second result is 2 and so forth. For example &start=11 gives the second page of results with the default â€œnumâ€ value of 10 results per page.Note: No more than 100 results will ever be returned for any query with JSON API, even if more than 100 documents match the query, so setting (start + num) to more than 100 will produce an error. Note that the maximum value for num is 10.

The following function call will produce two queries: â€œhotelâ€ in the USA, and â€œhotelâ€ in France

>>> serp_goog(q='hotel', gl=['us', 'fr'], cx='YOUR_CX', key='YOUR_KEY')

The below function call will prouce four queries and make four requests: â€œfligtsâ€ in UK â€œfligtsâ€ in Australia â€œticketsâ€ in UK â€œticketsâ€ in Australia â€˜crâ€™ here refers to â€˜country restrictâ€™, which focuses on content originating from the specified country.

>>> serp_goog(q=['flights', 'tickets'], cr=['countryUK', 'countryAU'],
              cx='YOUR_CX', key='YOUR_KEY')
serp_youtube(key, q=None, channelId=None, channelType=None, eventType=None, forContentOwner=None, forDeveloper=None, forMine=None, location=None, locationRadius=None, maxResults=None, onBehalfOfContentOwner=None, order=None, pageToken=None, publishedAfter=None, publishedBefore=None, regionCode=None, relatedToVideoId=None, relevanceLanguage=None, safeSearch=None, topicId=None, type=None, videoCaption=None, videoCategoryId=None, videoDefinition=None, videoDimension=None, videoDuration=None, videoEmbeddable=None, videoLicense=None, videoSyndicated=None, videoType=None)[source]Â¶

Query the YouTube API and get search results in a DataFrame. For each parameter you can supply a single or multiple value(s). Looping and merging results is handled automatically in case of multiple values.

Parameters

  • q â€“ (string) The q parameter specifies the query term to search for. Your request can also use the Boolean NOT (-) and OR (|) operators to exclude videos or to find videos that are associated with one of several search terms. For example, to search for videos matching either â€œboatingâ€ or â€œsailingâ€, set the q parameter value to boating|sailing. Similarly, to search for videos matching either â€œboatingâ€ or â€œsailingâ€ but not â€œfishingâ€, set the q parameter value to boating|sailing -fishing. Note that the pipe character must be URL- escaped when it is sent in your API request. The URL-escaped value for the pipe character is %7C.

  • channelId â€“ (string) The channelId parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources created by the channel. Note: Search results are constrained to a maximum of 500 videos if your request specifies a value for the channelId parameter and sets the type parameter value to video, but it does not also set one of the forContentOwner, forDeveloper, or forMine filters.

  • channelType â€“

    (string) The channelType parameter lets you restrict a search to a particular type of channel. Acceptable values are:

    any â€“ Return all channels.

    show â€“ Only retrieve shows.

  • eventType â€“

    (string) The eventType parameter restricts a search to broadcast events. If you specify a value for this parameter, you must also set the type parameterâ€™s value to video. Acceptable values are:

    completed â€“ Only include completed broadcasts.

    live â€“ Only include active broadcasts.

    upcoming â€“ Only include upcoming broadcasts.

  • forContentOwner â€“ (boolean) This parameter can only be used in a properly authorized request, and it is intended exclusively for YouTube content partners. The forContentOwner parameter restricts the search to only retrieve videos owned by the content owner identified by the onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter. If forContentOwner is set to true, the request must also meet these requirements:The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter is required.The user authorizing the request must be using an account linked to the specified content owner. The type parameter value must be set to video.None of the following other parameters can be set: videoDefinition, videoDimension, videoDuration, videoLicense, videoEmbeddable, videoSyndicated, videoType.

  • forDeveloper â€“ (boolean) This parameter can only be used in a properly authorized request. The forDeveloper parameter restricts the search to only retrieve videos uploaded via the developerâ€™s application or website. The API server uses the requestâ€™s authorization credentials to identify the developer. The forDeveloper parameter can be used in conjunction with optional search parameters like the q parameter. For this feature, each uploaded video is automatically tagged with the project number that is associated with the developerâ€™s application in the Google Developers Console. When a search request subsequently sets the forDeveloper parameter to true the API server uses the requestâ€™s authorization credentials to identify the developer. Therefore, a developer can restrict results to videos uploaded through the developerâ€™s own app or website but not to videos uploaded through other apps or sites.

  • forMine â€“ (boolean) This parameter can only be used in a properly authorized request. The forMine parameter restricts the search to only retrieve videos owned by the authenticated user. If you set this parameter to true, then the type parameterâ€™s value must also be set to video. In addition, none of the following other parameters can be set in the same request: videoDefinition, videoDimension, videoDuration, videoLicense, videoEmbeddable, videoSyndicated, videoType.

  • relatedToVideoId â€“ (string) The relatedToVideoId parameter retrieves a list of videos that are related to the video that the parameter value identifies. The parameter value must be set to a YouTube video ID and, if you are using this parameter, the type parameter must be set to video.Note that if the relatedToVideoId parameter is set, the only other supported parameters are part, maxResults, pageToken, regionCode, relevanceLanguage, safeSearch, type (which must be set to video), and fields.

  • location â€“ (string) The location parameter, in conjunction with the locationRadius parameter, defines a circular geographic area and also restricts a search to videos that specify, in their metadata, a geographic location that falls within that area. The parameter value is a string that specifies latitude/longitude coordinates e.g. (37.42307,-122.08427).The location parameter value identifies the point at the center of the area. The locationRadius parameter specifies the maximum distance that the location associated with a video can be from that point for the video to still be included in the search results. The API returns an error if your request specifies a value for the location parameter but does not also specify a value for the locationRadius parameter.

  • locationRadius â€“ (string) The locationRadius parameter, in conjunction with the location parameter, defines a circular geographic area. The parameter value must be a floating point number followed by a measurement unit. Valid measurement units are m, km, ft, and mi. For example, valid parameter values include 1500m, 5km, 10000ft, and 0.75mi. The API does not support locationRadius parameter values larger than 1000 kilometers. Note: See the definition of the location parameter for more information.

  • maxResults â€“ (unsigned integer) The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set. Acceptable values are 0 to 50, inclusive. The default value is 5.

  • onBehalfOfContentOwner â€“ (string) This parameter can only be used in a properly authorized request. Note: This parameter is intended exclusively for YouTube content partners.The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the requestâ€™s authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value. This parameter is intended for YouTube content partners that own and manage many different YouTube channels. It allows content owners to authenticate once and get access to all their video and channel data, without having to provide authentication credentials for each individual channel. The CMS account that the user authenticates with must be linked to the specified YouTube content owner.

  • order â€“

    (string) The order parameter specifies the method that will be used to order resources in the API response. The default value is relevance. Acceptable values are:

    date â€“ Resources are sorted in reverse chronological order based on the date they were created.

    rating â€“ Resources are sorted from highest to lowest rating.

    relevance â€“ Resources are sorted based on their relevance to the search query. This is the default value for this parameter.

    title â€“ Resources are sorted alphabetically by title.

    videoCount â€“ Channels are sorted in descending order of their number of uploaded videos.

    viewCount â€“ Resources sorted from highest to lowest number of views. For live broadcasts, videos are sorted by number of concurrent viewers while the broadcasts are ongoing.

  • pageToken â€“ (string) The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned. In an API response, the nextPageToken and prevPageToken properties identify other pages that could be retrieved.

  • publishedAfter â€“ (datetime) The publishedAfter parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources created at or after the specified time. The value is an RFC 3339 formatted date-time value (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z).

  • publishedBefore â€“ (datetime) The publishedBefore parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources created before or at the specified time. The value is an RFC 3339 formatted date-time value (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z).

  • regionCode â€“ (string) The regionCode parameter instructs the API to return search results for videos that can be viewed in the specified country. The parameter value is an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

  • relevanceLanguage â€“ (string) The relevanceLanguage parameter instructs the API to return search results that are most relevant to the specified language. The parameter value is typically an ISO 639-1 two-letter language code. However, you should use the values zh-Hans for simplified Chinese and zh-Hant for traditional Chinese. Please note that results in other languages will still be returned if they are highly relevant to the search query term.

  • safeSearch â€“

    (string) The safeSearch parameter indicates whether the search results should include restricted content as well as standard content. Acceptable values are:

    moderate â€“ YouTube will filter some content from search results and, at the least, will filter content that is restricted in your locale. Based on their content, search results could be removed from search results or demoted in search results. This is the default parameter value.

    none â€“ YouTube will not filter the search result set.

    strict â€“ YouTube will try to exclude all restricted content from the search result set.

    Based on their content, search results could be removed from search results or demoted in search results.

  • topicId â€“ (string) The topicId parameter indicates that the API response should only contain resources associated with the specified topic. The value identifies a Freebase topic ID.

  • type â€“ (string) The type parameter restricts a search query to only retrieve a particular type of resource. The value is a comma-separated list of resource types. The default value is video,channel,playlist. Acceptable values are: channel, playlist, and video

  • videoCaption â€“

    (string) The videoCaption parameter indicates whether the API should filter video search results based on whether they have captions. If you specify a value for this parameter, you must also set the type parameterâ€™s value to video. Acceptable values are:

    any â€“ Do not filter results based on caption availability.

    closedCaption â€“ Only include videos that have captions.

    none â€“ Only include videos that do not have captions.

  • videoCategoryId â€“ (string) The videoCategoryId parameter filters video search results based on their category. If you specify a value for this parameter, you must also set the type parameterâ€™s value to video.

  • videoDefinition â€“

    (string) The videoDefinition parameter lets you restrict a search to only include either high definition (HD) or standard definition (SD) videos. HD videos are available for playback in at least 720p, though higher resolutions, like 1080p, might also be available. If you specify a value for this parameter, you must also set the type parameterâ€™s value to video. Acceptable values are:

    any â€“ Return all videos, regardless of their resolution.

    high â€“ Only retrieve HD videos.

    standard â€“ Only retrieve videos in standard definition.

  • videoDimension â€“

    (string) The videoDimension parameter lets you restrict a search to only retrieve 2D or 3D videos. If you specify a value for this parameter, you must also set the type parameterâ€™s value to video. Acceptable values are:

    2d â€“ Restrict search results to exclude 3D videos.

    3d â€“ Restrict search results to only include 3D videos.

    any â€“ Include both 3D and non-3D videos in returned results. This is the default value.

  • videoDuration â€“

    (string) The videoDuration parameter filters video search results based on their duration. If you specify a value for this parameter, you must also set the type parameterâ€™s value to video. Acceptable values are:

    any â€“ Do not filter video search results based on their duration. This is the default value.

    long â€“ Only include videos longer than 20 minutes.

    medium â€“ Only include videos that are between four and 20 minutes long (inclusive).

    short â€“ Only include videos that are less than four minutes long.

  • videoEmbeddable â€“

    (string) The videoEmbeddable parameter lets you to restrict a search to only videos that can be embedded into a webpage. If you specify a value for this parameter, you must also set the type parameterâ€™s value to video. Acceptable values are:

    any â€“ Return all videos, embeddable or not.

    true â€“ Only retrieve embeddable videos.

  • videoLicense â€“

    (string) The videoLicense parameter filters search results to only include videos with a particular license. YouTube lets video uploaders choose to attach either the Creative Commons license or the standard YouTube license to each of their videos. If you specify a value for this parameter, you must also set the type parameterâ€™s value to video. Acceptable values are:

    any â€“ Return all videos, regardless of which license they have, that match the query parameters.

    creativeCommon â€“ Only return videos that have a Creative Commons license. Users can reuse videos with this license in other videos that they create.

    youtube â€“ Only return videos that have the standard YouTube license.

  • videoSyndicated â€“

    (string) The videoSyndicated parameter lets you to restrict a search to only videos that can be played outside youtube.com. If you specify a value for this parameter, you must also set the type parameterâ€™s value to video. Acceptable values are:

    any â€“ Return all videos, syndicated or not.

    true â€“ Only retrieve syndicated videos.

  • videoType â€“

    (string) The videoType parameter lets you restrict a search to a particular type of videos. If you specify a value for this parameter, you must also set the type parameterâ€™s value to video. Acceptable values are:

    any â€“ Return all videos.

    episode â€“ Only retrieve episodes of shows.

    movie â€“ Only retrieve movies.

set_logging_level(level_or_name)[source]Â¶

Change the logging level during the session. Acceptable values are [0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, â€˜NOTSETâ€™, â€˜DEBUGâ€™, â€˜INFOâ€™, â€˜WARNINGâ€™, â€˜ERRORâ€™, â€˜CRITICALâ€™]

youtube_channel_details(key, channel_ids)[source]Â¶

Return details of channels for which the ids are given. Assumes ids is a comma-separated list of channel ids with no spaces.

youtube_video_details(key, vid_ids)[source]Â¶

Return details of videos for which the ids are given. Assumes ids is a comma-separated list of video ids with no spaces.
